paper_abstract: For a vertex v of a connected graph G(V,E) and a subset S of V, the distance between a vertex v and S is defined by d(v, S) = min{d(v, x): x is an element of S). For an ordered k-partition pi = {S-1, S-2...S-k} of V, the partition representation of v with respect to pi is the k-vector r(v vertical bar pi) = (d(v, Si), d(v, S-2)...d(v, S-k)). The k-partition pi is a resolving partition if the k-vectors r(v vertical bar pi), v is an element of V (G) are distinct. The minimum k for which there is a resolving k-partition of V is the partition dimension of G. Salman et al. [1] in their paper which appeared in Acta Mathematica Sinica, English Series proved that partition dimension of a class of circulant graph G(n,+/-{1, 2}), for all even n >= 6 is four. In this paper we prove that it is three. (C) 2014 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: On the partition dimension of a class of circulant graphs
